intro: Lycimnia suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented lycimnia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. Lycimnia suaveolens is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
